did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.abstract: The album contains about 60 colored postcards in a series by Henri Gervese entitled "Nos Marins" which humorously depict the life of a French sailor.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: World War I Postcard Album, 1914-1918, in the Joseph M. Bruccoli Great War Collection, Accession #10875-ad, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This album was given to the University of Virginia Library by Dexter Whitehead, Crozet, Virginia, on December 20, 1994.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This addition to the Joseph M. Bruccoli Great War Collection consists of one album of about sixty French colored postcards, ca. 1914-1918, by French caricaturist Henri Gervese (1880-1959), entitled "Nos Marins" [Our Sailors]. The postcards portray the life of the French sailor in a humorous manner and include scenes of drilling, preparing for inspection, getting along with officers, physical and mental training, mail call, reporting for duty, chow time, class distinctions, entertainment, kitchen duty, seasickness, weapons deployment, laundry day, and other related events. Most of the inscriptions on the cards are in French but a few have English as well
